review_preview: I first visited Taberna La Concha in May of 2012 and it is this place that made me start eating meat again (I was a vegetarian for 7 years prior to this).  My boyfriend at the time ordered the curry chicken and I tried the...
review_full: I first visited Taberna La Concha in May of 2012 and it is this place that made me start eating meat again (I was a vegetarian for 7 years prior to this). My boyfriend at the time ordered the curry chicken and I tried the sauce because he said it was the most amazing thing he had ever tasted. Then, I just said "screw it" and ate a piece of the chicken. This was the first time that I had eaten meat in 7 years.  Recently, I moved to Madrid and knew that I had to visit this tapas bar to see if it was as good as I remembered. It was. Taberna la Concha has quickly become my favorite place in all of Madrid. It is centrally located in La Latina (near Plaza Mayor) and the chef is the nicest person ever. He speaks perfect English which is a plus for me because I still struggle greatly with the Spanish language. Also, the last time I visited this bar the chef gave us a free dessert and a free glass of rojo cava (a sort of sparkling wine native to Spain).  I promise that if you dine/drink at this bar you will not be disappointed. This is the best tapas bar in all of Madrid. I am sure of it.

review_preview: Chanced upon this restaurant as we were walking around on a Sunday evening searching for a place to have dinner. We were the first ones in but that didn't last long. Ordered the pimientos de padron, croquetas de jamon iberica, mixed paella and pumpkin ravioli....
review_full: Chanced upon this restaurant as we were walking around on a Sunday evening searching for a place to have dinner. We were the first ones in but that didn't last long. Ordered the pimientos de padron, croquetas de jamon iberica, mixed paella and pumpkin ravioli. For drinks we had cerveza (can't recall the brand) and a sangria, plus 2 bottlesof water. Finally for dessert my husband ordered a passionfruit cake ( which turned out to be cheesecake). The waiter brought out a complimentary bowl of green olives. The pimientos de padron had a nice char on them with a sprinkling of sea salt. The croquetas were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside as they should be. The portion sizes are generous. In fact, we didn't finish the pimientos de padron even though we tried and ate them after our mains came. My husband devoured his pumpkin ravioli. My mixed paella was very aromatic and delicious. It had some squid, mussels, pork rib, chicken, and a large whole prawn. The rice was very flavorful. The portion size is enough for 2 people if you're sharing other dishes or generous for one person. I found the cheesecake to be too sweet for me but my husband loved it. Then again I'm not a sweets person. The presentation of the food was spot on as we ate with our eyes first when they were brought to our table. Service was excellent. Would come back and recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a good meal at reasonable prices. Our meal with drinks came to 50.90 euros.

review_preview: My family and I went there after reading the reviews on here and it did not disappoint! It had average food prices so it wasn’t overpriced. My mom, sister, and I each got our own meals. My sister and I both had the peeled seafood...
review_full: My family and I went there after reading the reviews on here and it did not disappoint! It had average food prices so it wasn’t overpriced. My mom, sister, and I each got our own meals. My sister and I both had the peeled seafood paella and my mom had the grilled octopus. Everything was delicious. They have an extensive beer and wine menu if you’re looking to have a drink. The waiter was friendly and accommodating as well.  Last time I was in Spain, a local told me that a lot of restaurants use frozen paella and to get from places that only cook it fresh. I got frozen paella last time (in Seville) and it was gross (I knew it was frozen because they didn’t heat it up all the way). This was definitely fresh.  Highly recommend!

For 5 euro they were a bargain- we could not eat them all. Very tasty! I ordered a salad with burrata cheese. There was plenty of cheese and the rocket and tomatoes were nice, but the salad needed some balsamic vinegar. I ordered the shelled seafood paella. It was very tasty but a tad dry. I think it lacked some spice. It had nice mussels calamari rings and shrimp. For 12.50 euro it was worth the money  Hubby had the grilled octopus. It came with fries and a side of sliced cucumbers. It was a giant piece of octopus,but tender for its size and had nice herb seasoning. Our server was very polite and we enjoyed talking with him. A nice cozy restaurant.

title_review: Authentic high end Madrid food, hospitality and ambience loved by the locals
review_preview: My wife and I had perhaps the most enjoyable dinner in our two weeks in Spain, thanks to our hotel manager (Hotel Orfila) who told us about this restaurant.  The ambience is warm and bright without being pretentious.  There were few people there at 9:00...
review_full: My wife and I had perhaps the most enjoyable dinner in our two weeks in Spain, thanks to our hotel manager (Hotel Orfila) who told us about this restaurant. The ambience is warm and bright without being pretentious. There were few people there at 9:00 on a Saturday night, the time of our reservation, but the place was packed by 11:00. Except for one other table and ours, all of the patrons were locals and it was obvious that this was both a dining and social experience for them. Most of the men had blazers or sports coats and the women wore dressers. No poorly dressed tourists with their I-phones being used!!! Wonderful.  A great menu with many choices for appetizers, first courses and entrees. We very much enjoyed the oxtails in a rich and tasty sauce and the venison steak with sauce and local fruit compotes. The manager attended to each table, was very friendly and his wine selections were perfectly paired. He and the staff were not proficient at English, but they have English menus and all went well with their limited English and our limited Spanish. The cost with wine was about 65 euros each and we considered it very reasonable.

title_review: Elegant Restaurant Showcasing Madrid's High Standards of Service
review_preview: On our last night in Madrid on a trip primarily to Andalusia with friends, we had dinner at La Paloma.  It sits in a charming neighborhood just a short taxi ride from our hotel near the Prado museum.  The food was excellent and varied.  Our...
review_full: On our last night in Madrid on a trip primarily to Andalusia with friends, we had dinner at La Paloma. It sits in a charming neighborhood just a short taxi ride from our hotel near the Prado museum. The food was excellent and varied. Our group, which included teenagers and adults (including two vegetarians) all found many delightful options. The red tuna tartare, crispy spring rolls, and suckling pig were my favorites. All of the options come in full and half portions (more than half, actually), which enabled our group to experiment.  Putting aside the delicious food, the best part about La Paloma is the attentive and friendly service. The servers take a formal, old-school approach to dining service, but it never felt stuffy. Our Spanish was "un poco," at best, and the staff really seemed to enjoy the fact that we were there. At the end of the evening, the owner/manager (?) came by and gave us free tastings of various highly-potent Spanish after-dinner liquors (similar to Italian grappa).  La Paloma is a more formal restaurant than many of the Spanish tapas restaurants, but the excellent food, terrific wine list and top-notch service make this a great choice - even among all the terrific options Madrid has to offer.

review_preview: I found this restaurant on the web and after checking it out on trip advisor booked it through their website. I'm so glad we went. The food was superb and was matched by the setting. I had Iberian ham followed by Tuna. Both were superb...
review_full: I found this restaurant on the web and after checking it out on trip advisor booked it through their website. I'm so glad we went. The food was superb and was matched by the setting. I had Iberian ham followed by Tuna. Both were superb and plentiful. My wife had the steak and this was cooked exactly as requested. The house red was a very nice Rioja. You can find cheaper restaurants in Madrid all serving up the same tourist menu, but even if it is just for one evening try La Paloma. I have paid far more than this in London and come away disappointed. You will not be disappointed at La Paloma. No gimmicks, just excellent food and service in a very nice setting. If you can speak a little Spanish it will probably enhance your visit but I don't think it is essential. I recommend you try this proper Spanish restaurant. Next time I am in Madrid I will return.

review_full: It is a very nice restaurant which you see immediately when your enter. Stylish decor end good taste all over. And the food is just excellent and made from fresh rawmaterials every day. We celebrated a birthday dinner there, and we were 8 persons where of 6 were Spanish, so they are aware how good food should taste in Madrid. All were very happy and satisfied. We had a 4 course dinner with Cava and White and red wine, plus Coffee - Price Eur 65 per person, which was totally reasonable or even "cheap". The service was professional all over, and we will be back when possible.

review_full: Keep this address to yourself and plan to get there a bit before it opens to be sure you get a chance to be seated at one of the 20 seats available in this tiny restaurant in the basement. It’s not a fancy place by far but the food is out of this world: authentic, flavourful, creative, plentiful! The tapas are not the usual fare that you find in most local restaurants. They’re unique and more tasteful than what you might be accustomed to. All the menu items are available without gluten if you choose to. Kudos to the Chef for the thought. The local wines are excellent. The lady who assumes the service by herself is extremely cordial, fast and efficient. The prices are very reasonable. I can’t think of a better place anywhere with a similar offering! It’s worthy of a Michelin star just for the culinary aspect. Will go back there for sure!

review_preview: After spending the past 4 days in Madrid, finding it very difficult to get gluten free food (I’m a coeliac), I did some research online and found this little gem was suggested. It literally is a hidden gem! It’s the first place we’ve come to...
review_full: After spending the past 4 days in Madrid, finding it very difficult to get gluten free food (I’m a coeliac), I did some research online and found this little gem was suggested. It literally is a hidden gem! It’s the first place we’ve come to that understand “sin gluten” and they were able to hand us a gluten free menu straight away with no fuss. 100% stress free! The gentleman who looked after us was spot on, very happy and attentive, very good knowledge of his menu and drinks he served, and was able to recommend the right amount of dishes to suit us. The food is lovely, none of that typical “gluten free” taste. Easily the best meal out I’ve enjoyed in a long time, as well as in Madrid. Highly recommended to everyone! Just to note.. I came with my brother who isn’t gluten free and he also enjoyed it very much. They have various menus for all/no dietary requirements.

We were warmly greeted and shown to a large corner table that was home for the next few hours as we settled in for a relaxing dinner. Our starters included a very tasty lobster salad and onion soup. Mains included a delicious roast suckling pig with big hand made french fries and seafood ravioli that were outstanding. Nice wine list. Professional, friendly service. We were too full to sample the deserts but they looked yummy!

review_preview: One of the most gorgeous restaurants I've ever been in.  Picasso's dove alights on the napkins & reproduction paintings line the walls.  Everything gleams with elegance including the excellent staff.  Carpaccio of foie gras was paper thin slices of delicious foie gras drizzled with olive...
review_full: One of the most gorgeous restaurants I've ever been in. Picasso's dove alights on the napkins & reproduction paintings line the walls. Everything gleams with elegance including the excellent staff. Carpaccio of foie gras was paper thin slices of delicious foie gras drizzled with olive oil, flecked w/sea salt - to die for! The lobster bisque was the real thing & oysters fresh & delisious! You can order 1/2 plates of the main courses so we shared monkfish (rape), cod (bacalo), sweet breads (mollejas de ternera) & their famous crispy roast pig (conchillo). Chocolate souffle & apple tart for dessert. Too much but oh so satisfying:) Dress up a little as this place deserves that respect.
